title: Uncle admits role in 7-year-old's shooting death
content:
ADAMS COUNTY, Ill. (WGEM) -
One of three family members charged in the shooting death of a seven-year-old girl is headed to prison.
Daniel Roberts, 32, of Quincy, pleaded guilty to charges of endangering the life of a child and possession of a weapon by a felon Wednesday. An obstruction of justice charge was dropped.
Police arrested Roberts hours after Melina Torres was shot at a family gathering southeast of Liberty on May 20th. Police said at the time it appeared the family was doing some target practice at the home.
Court records state Roberts gave a three year old a loaded .22 rifle, and the child pulled the trigger, shooting Melina Torres. Police accused Roberts of trying to hide the gun, which they said was owned by Shannon Combes, to keep Combes from being prosecuted.
Roberts was sentenced to four-and-a-half years in prison on both charges.
Combes was charged with possession of a weapon by a felon.
Melina's mother, Karen Torres, and grandmother, Julie Roberts Cole, were charged with obstructing justice.
